intro: Marsdenia mayottae, commonly known as the Mayotte Marsdenia, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of Mayotte in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic and ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy surface. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by follicles containing seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
